newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian miller reports 1996 net of 5.3 mln kuna.
newsitem.headline: Croatian miller reports 1996 net of 5.3 mln kuna.

text.p: Croatian miller and baker Mlinar announced net profit for calendar 1996 of 5.3 million kuna and said total income had risen three percent to 140 million kuna.
It will propose dividend of an unchanged 18 kuna to shareholders, general manager Dragutin Barisic said in an advertisement in Vecernji List at the weekend.
"Although last year's output had fallen slightly, it was overall a more successful year," Barisic said.
He said the company would "no longer tolerate" late payment by some customers. Mlinar would rather stop sales to them than chase old payments and face liquidity problems, Barisic said.
He said the company's results were reduced by 10 percent because of a month-long stoppage by the country's millers last year, caused by wheat shortages after excessive exports.

Small shareholders control 76 percent of the company. It is one of the largest millers and bakers in Croatia with its own retail network in the northwestern part of the country. -- Zagreb Newsroom, +385 1 455 7075
